rights.title: 8. User Rights under GDPR
rights.items: Right of Access: You can request information on whether we process your personal data and obtain a copy of it.
Right to Rectification: You can request that we correct any inaccuracies in your personal data.
Right to Erasure: You can request the deletion of your personal data in certain circumstances (for example, if it is no longer needed for the purposes it was collected).
Right to Data Portability: You can request a copy of your personal data in a structured, commonly used electronic format, and you can ask us to transfer it to another service provider where feasible.

Right to Withdraw Consent: If we process your personal data based on your consent, you have the right to withdraw that consent at any time (this will not affect the lawfulness of processing before withdrawal).
Right to Object: You can object to the processing of your personal data for certain purposes, such as direct marketing or when processing is based on our legitimate interests.

Right to Lodge a Complaint: You have the right to lodge a complaint with a data protection supervisory authority (for example, the Hungarian National Authority for Data Protection and Freedom of Information – NAIH).

cookie.text1: StorageR uses cookies and similar technologies to ensure the proper functioning of the website and to enhance the user experience.

cookie.text3: Users have control over non-essential cookies. We will request your consent before using non-essential cookies, and you can withdraw your consent at any time. You can manage or disable cookies in your web browser settings; however, note that disabling certain cookies may affect functionality of the service.

If an amicable resolution cannot be reached, any dispute arising from or related to these terms or the use of the StorageR service shall fall under the jurisdiction of the courts of Hungary.
dispute.text2: If you are a consumer, you have the option to pursue out-of-court dispute resolution before resorting to litigation. You may contact the Conciliation Board of Zala County (address: 8900 Zalaegerszeg, Petőfi utca 24., email: zmbekelteto@zmkik.hu, phone: +36 92 550 513), or the competent conciliation body in your area. Additionally, you can use the EU online dispute resolution platform at https://ec.europa.eu/consumers/odr.
